Body:
I'm evaluating AWS IoT Services, and sending cpu_usage and available_memory for a Gateway.

I would like to visualize the data on a graph.

Using AWS IoT SDK, I can easy send data over MQTT to AWS IoT Core.

But then, I have no idea how to visualize the data.

I have seen this tuto from AWS that use Kinesis Firehose/Analytics and QuickSight to visualize data
column9:
but it just seems too much (and too expensive) for my use case.

I have also seen this tuto that use ELK to visualize the data
column11:
I have no money to spend on a dedicated ELK instance just to visualize little data.

I tried to send data to CloudWatch using a Rule
column12:
but with query:

SELECT free_memory FROM topic_1

But I can't see this metric.

I also asked for AWS IoT Graph preview access hoping it will resolve my issue
column13:
but I am right now a bit lost.

Is there an easy / free tier compatible way to visualize data from IoT devices ?

"
